clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Study of Upper and Lower Endoscopic Fuse System
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study of Upper and Lower Endoscopic Fuse System

brief_summary.textblock: Single-Center, Exploratory Study of EndoChoice's Upper and Lower Gastrointestinal Endoscopic Systems Utilizing EndoChoice's Full Spectrum Optical Technology

detailed_description.textblock: The investigational devices are EndoChoice gastrointestinal endoscopic systems that are similar in their fit, form, and functions to the corresponding commercially available models with the exception of the EndoChoice's proprietary Optical system that enhances their field of view.

primary_outcome.measure: Performance, usability and ease of use (performance questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, estimate average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The performance of the device is assessed via a performance questionnaire which the recruiting (and treatment providing) physician will answer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, estimate average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Establish safety of the device by measure of adverse and severe adverse events, if such occur.

intervention.description: Endoscopic diagnostic procedures for lower GI tract
Endoscopic diagnostic procedures for upper GI tract

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and Female patients ages of 18-75
- The patient has been scheduled for routine screening upper or lower endoscopy, diagnostic endoscopic work up, or endoscopic surveillance.
- Signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are currently enrolled in another clinical investigation in which the intervention might compromise the safety of the patient's participation in this study.
- Patients who are unable to consent
- Pregnant female patients of any age.
